overview_of_class: This course will survey selected concepts and practices of experimental new music of the last few decades, focusing on the efforts of living composers to push the performance and sonic limits of music. In order to dissect and understand the musical experience, we will discuss the ideas and methods behind specific works, while also considering the demands they make on both performers and listeners.  Relationships to other art forms (e.g. film, visual, theater, etc.) as well as social/historical context are further points of interest.  Requirements include daily participation in discussion, written reflections, ability to think critically, and attendance at several concerts and an open mind.
name: Selected Topics in Music Literature for Non-Majors
